item.title: STM32 microblink
item.description: Disclaimer: The following text is written by someone who knows next to nothing about microcontrollers. The writer was also drinking beer. Please donâ€™t use it as a source for anything other than entertainment purposes. If you’ve ever fiddled around with microcontroller development boards, you’ve probably noticed that blinking an LED is pretty much the hello world of the microcontroller world. By no means am I an expert in bare-metal programming, but to me, it seems that the usual procedure for creating an MCU hello world is the following:
